captions.text: - Boo, boop.
Hello
Let's be cool, let's be cool.
What's up?
Don't judge this scot glass-- Scot glass?

They say the best chefs cook
on the highest temperatures.
And I say, "So do I".
Does that make me good?
Late 80s are back.
Oh, god.
Mama's a little drunk.

Yeah, it's going to be
one of those kitchens.
Hola, everybody.

This week on My Drunk Kitchen,
we're making enchiladas.
"Why?" you may ask.

Because, when you set out
to get something done,
or to marry someone,

or to commit to a new thing in
your life, like a big change,
you must embrace it for all that it is.

You must, in fact, accept
the whole enchilada.
Oooooh!
(mumbling)

Don't judge a scotch
glass by its contents.

It says scotch on the
outside, but on the inside,

it feels more like a
mixed tequila-based drink.

Step numero uno in
making an enchilada is to
"pour the oil into a medium pot,

and warm it up until it's
hot, but not sizzling."
Cheers, my dears!
That's not my mouth.
Mmmmmmm!
(sings)
Ahhhh!
Oil be the judge of that.
This is a tortilla.
This is a hand full of cheese.

These are the basic
ingredients of an enchilada.
But, we don't want to burn our tortillas.

But, we're going to
lightly cook, but not fry,

the tortillas, so that we can
wrap them around the cheese,
without them breaking.
It broke.
(sings)

While this lightly cooks,
you want to go ahead and
prep your paper towel and your plate,
so you can get all the oil off of it,

and then touch it later,
without it being super oily.
Don't burn yourself.
If you don't have tongs, use chopsticks.
Mmmmmm!
Ow! Who knew?
Great.

Next, take your baking
dish, and ... cuddle it.

Pour enchilada sauce to
lightly coat the bottom.
Boo boop!
Coat the baste of your baking thing--

Set your expectations
like a fine spicy base.
If you proportion them evenly,
meaning, not too high, and not too low,
you're guaranteed to find success.

Small disclaimer: There are
no guarantees ... in life.
Next step is to take your enchilada,

and put it in a bowl with
more enchilada sauce.

But, I'm pretty sure I can
just roll this around in here.
Yeah, yeah.
And then stuff it with cheese,
roll it up, and scootch it to the side.
Add some cheese, in queso emergency.
The warm, gooey cheese is like your own
malleable, flexible nature,
which can bend and twist to any

new adventure that life
sets out before you.
Ooooh! Can you guys see what I'm doing?
I hope so, because I feel like
we're going to make a good, tasty thing.
Another one of this.
I really hate when my hands get sticky.

I really didn't want to
compromise in this way,
but I'm in it, and I'm gonna win it.
Find your way to cope.
Mmmmm.

It's hot in here, there must
be 'chiladas in the atmosphere.
Roll it, roll it, roll it a lot.
Ooooh, more cheeses.

Just in case things get
dicey, like these onions,

remember, that's a natural
part of the journey you're on.

You've made a commitment,
and you're going to

adhere to that commitment by
accepting the whole enchilada.
We're really running with this theme.
And now we roll, and we're rolling,
and we're rolling with the punches.
Mmmmm!
Last but not least, take your final--
An interloper.
You're going to take this enchilada,
and you're going to add chicken to it,
because you want meat, and you are hungry.
Are you guys ever drinking,
and you breathe out through your nose?
Next, we're going to add some protein.
"What kind of protein?" you may ask?
The canned chicken kind, of course.
Oh, god.

This is canned chicken,
smells a lot like tuna,
looks a lot like sadness.

Wrap it up ... is what
you're telling yourself
about this video, on a whole.
Great, this one has canned chicken in it.
Yummmm!

Now that you've got a base
of four more enchiladas,

poor more enchilada
sauce all over the top.

Take some mozzarella,
sprinkle it all over the top.

Because, at least if
it's covered in cheese,

you'll still be compelled,
naturally, to eat it.
Take this beautiful monstrosity,

and put it in the oven
for 20 or 30 minutes.
Have fun!
Now wash your hands.
Cheers. Mmmmmm.
Oh, my god, it smells like cat food.

You guys know that point
in alcohol consumption,
where you can't taste alcohol any more?

That's what I like to
call, "The Danger Zone".
It means, anything after that point,
is dangerous for you to do.
(whistles)
Holy shit, it looks delicious!
Oh, my god! We've done it again.
Holiest of guacamoliest, guys!
We've made a real food.
Ow, it's hot! You burnt me!
I don't know if I accept that.
Garnish, garnish, garnish.
It's a whole enchilada, just for me.
Now, add avocado.
"Why?" you may ask.

Mainly, just because
you really want avocado.
Hot, you wait, too hot!
Mmmmm!
Happy Enchilada Day.
The whole enchilada.
Subscribe to this channel, where we are at

for new videos, every
Tuesday and Thursday,
and new recipes every time we make them.
Guys, this is really, it's quite good.
If you made an enchilada at home,
take a picture, and send it to me.

title: MY DRUNK KITCHEN: The Whole Enchilada

comments.text:
Ahh, my gosh, Hannah, I loves you!! I have to make enchiladas now! It's 
crazy because my mom makes them, SO AWESOME, forever and.. I'm a mom of six 
myself and have never made them.. myself.. o.0 I know, right!?!
Also! You've inspired me to do my own cooking show! Though, not drunkily. 
Well, not always. Maybe have a "Fun Friday" or something.. and I'm thinking 
maybe I'll go with a 50s theme.. maybe? I don't know, still brainstorming 
but definitely dreaming! Oh, hey, we're the same age! Not sure why but I 
thought I'd tell you. And yeah, I have six kids. =P ^.^﻿

comments.text:
Sweetie...you should make EASY enchiladas. instead of rolling them. You 
slightly fry the tortilla then you lay it in a glass pan, you put some 
sauce then cheese/chicken/beef...black olives more enchilada sauce if 
needed then another tortilla...repeat process till you get to the 
top...cover with aluminum foil and bake till hot. yum...cut a square piece 
out and serve. hello boop boop...﻿
